items.text: 127kph, shorter length, on the hip, it comes off the thigh guard and runs to fine leg for a couple of leg byes
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Tamim Iqbal, 2 leg byes

items.text: caught behind! Well bowled. Angled in back of a length, it nipped away off the seam, he was squared up on the back foot, forced to play, gets a thin edge and an easy catch for de Kock!
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Tamim Iqbal, OUT

dismissal.text: Tamim Iqbal c †de Kock b Phehlukwayo 16 (40m 29b 2x4 0x6) SR: 55.17

items.preText: Shakib Al Hasan enters to a big roar. Lots of Bangladesh support at the Oval.
items.text: 126kph, good length, angled in, he defends comfortably on the front foot
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: 132kph, powerful square drive and JP Duminy makes a flying stop at backward point! Duminy flew like Jonty Rhodes to make that save
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: 132kph, shorter length, tucking him up, he defends on the back foot
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: 133kph, top of off, he defends from the crease
items.postText: Anil : "This is not a Gayle show, this is not a Warner show, this is Soumya Sarkar show. He destroying the every short ball. Interesting to see the plan B of south africa for Soumya Sarkar."
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: 143kph, fuller and shaping away and he drives but misses
items.shortText: Rabada to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText: Andrew Miller: "The first sighting of South African flags in the stands at that wicket. It's felt an entirely Bangladesh crowd this morning, but maybe one in five of the green shirts is green and yellow, not green and red."
items.text: 139kph, shorter wide of off, he rides the bounce and runs this to third man
items.shortText: Rabada to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: square drive on the up through point! Some width offered and on the front foot he flashed the hands through it and placed it perfectly into the gap
items.shortText: Rabada to Shakib Al Hasan, FOUR runs

items.text: big flash and miss trying to square drive again. Beaten for extra bounce
items.shortText: Rabada to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.preText: Abdul: "@Rohan, Tamim was in the crease when the throw came while Inzamam was out of the crease. That's the difference between the two cases."
items.text: 138kph, good length, top of off, he defends on the front foot
items.shortText: Rabada to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: 145kph full outside off, he steers this off the front foot to backward point
items.postText: 10 over Powerplay complete. Bangladesh are 1 for 65. Four men out now.
items.shortText: Rabada to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: Huge appeal for LBW. Given not out. Faf reviews quickly. From around the wicket, angled in and nipping back. He was caught on the crease and hit just above the knee roll. No bat. Ball tracking says umpire's call. Not out remains. Ball tracking had it hitting the top of leg. South Africa keep the review but Soumya survives and they get a leg bye
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Soumya Sarkar, 1 leg bye

items.text: good length, he's running this with an open face to third man
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: driven powerfully up and over cover! Too full and wide and he threw the hands through it, didn't bother to keep it down, just smashed it over cover!
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Soumya Sarkar, FOUR runs

items.text: 131kph, bouncer, high and and angled down leg, not called wide? That was very high and angled down. Some leeway given there by Joel Wilson
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: fuller wide of off, he slices it on the front foot through gully to wide third man
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: full and swinging down the leg side and this is wide
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 wide

items.text: 129kph, good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot to cover-point
items.postText: Innocent Bamuri: "Andile Phehlukwayo's record of picking up much needed wickets is still intact. I like how the Bangladeshi openers have performed, I wish they would have considered Andile's aforementioned record. Game building up nicely."
items.shortText: Phehlukwayo to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.preText: Chris Morris into the attack. Around the wicket
items.text: back of a length outside off, he pushes off the back foot to backward point
items.postText: ESPNcricinfo's Forecaster had Bangladesh starting off the innings with a predicted total of 265. But with the start they've got in the first ten overs, and with most of their batting still intact, Forecaster estimates that Bangladesh have the potential to top 300 in this innings.
items.shortText: Morris to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: good length, 136kph, on middle, he works it with the angle behind square leg
items.shortText: Morris to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.preText: Priyankar Ray C: "Sarkar looks like the Ganguly of old with those crisp off drives. His pulls are even better than Ganguly's"
items.text: 138kph, fuller on leg, he glances with the angle to fine leg
items.shortText: Morris to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: Caught behind! A short ball gets him due to a lack of pace! It was banged in and angled down leg, he shaped to pull, it held in the surface, he got through the shot too soon, it comes off the gloves and pops up behind him, de Kock sprinted forward dived and took an excellent catch
items.shortText: Morris to Soumya Sarkar, OUT

dismissal.text: Soumya Sarkar c †de Kock b Morris 42 (58m 30b 9x4 0x6) SR: 140.00

items.text: 136kph, back of a length on off, he is back and across and defending
items.shortText: Morris to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: There's a hold up. Some problem with the sight screen.
items.text: short and wide and a cracking cut shot over backward point! he thumped this. Didn't bother to keep it down. Just thrashed it flat behind point. Super shot to get off the mark
items.shortText: Morris to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs
